intro: Rubus × semicalvifolius, commonly known as the bracted blackberry, is a hybrid shrub belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in gardens and agricultural settings.
